question:
Which of the following is / are correct statements about the recently discovered Yaravirus?
  1. Most of its genome was not observed in any other viruses discovered so far
  2. It has affected humans for the first time in history in Brazil
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Scientists announced the recent discovery of Yaravirus, a never before seen virus that is unique from all known viruses of its kind, in Brazil. Yaravirus infects amoeba. The Yaravirus is a newly discovered virus that infects amoeba. It does not affect humans. It is much smaller (80nm) than other viruses (over 200nm) that target amoeba. Though the species is newly discovered, scientists say that the virus has been existing on Earth for ages. It was discovered in Brazil. The Yaravirus was discovered in Brazil. It was discovered in the artificially created Lake Pampulha. The virus is named after Yara, ‘the mother of waters’, from the mythical stories of the Tupi Guarani people- an indigenous tribe. The new virus poses a challenge to how DNA based viruses are classified. Most of the components of the virus’ genome had not been observed before. The Yaravirus is unique both in terms of phylogeny and origin. About 90% of its genome has not been observed by scientists in other viruses. It lacks all of the ‘classical viral genes’. The viral particles are composed of a huge amount of unknown proteins according to the scientists.
